title: schema parser sets default value for numeric to empty string
body:
### expected behaviour
app installation including table creation should not fail.

### actual behaviour
when installing an app which has a numeric data type with empty default value in the schema definition the installation fails.

### steps to reproduce
1. download an app where a numeric data type has an empty default value, e.g. ````appinfo/database.xml```` could look like this:
```
<field>
        <name>modified</name>
        <type>decimal</type>
        <default/>
        <notnull>true</notnull>
        <length>15</length>
</field>
```
2. activate app in admin panel
3. check your database log for the error

### server configuration

database: mysql

owncloud version: oc6 beta 3

### logs
#### web server error log
```
an exception occurred while executing 'create table `oc_mozilla_sync_wbo` (`id` int unsigned auto_increment not null, `collectionid` int unsigned default 0 not null, `name` varchar(64) default '' not null, `parentid` varchar(64) default null, `predecessorid` varchar(64) default null, `sortindex` int unsigned default 0 not null, `modified` numeric(10, 0) default '' not null, `payload` longtext default '' not null, `ttl` int unsigned default 0 not null, index mozilla_sync_wbo_collectionid (`collectionid`), index mozilla_sync_wbo_coll_name (`collectionid`, `name`), index mozilla_sync_wbo_coll_name_mod (`collectionid`, `name`, `modified`), primary key(`id`)) default character set utf8 collate utf8_unicode_ci engine = innodb': sqlstate[42000]: syntax error or access violation: 1067 invalid default value for 'modified'
```
